p: Cell permissiveness to a virus in a cell compartment is defined by the presence of specific receptors and entry pathways, but also by the presence of cellular proteins favoring or restricting viral replication, and of other cellular determinants. The rationale of the studies that have been carried out in skeletal muscle over the last few years have aimed at exploring the mechanisms behind the frequent symptomatology of pain, inflammation, and degeneration of muscle following arbovirus infection.
